Package it.polimi.ingsw.client

Class View

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.utils.Observable<PlayerAction>
it.polimi.ingsw.client.View
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<ServerResponse>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SwingView
public class View
extends Observable<PlayerAction>
implements Observer<ServerResponse>
Class that implements the user view of the game, if he selects to use the Command Line Interface

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    View()
    Creates a new view and prints SANTORINI with ascii art

    Ask if a target cell of the battlefield is free or not It is free if there is not a token on it nor a dome

    boolean notPerimeterCell​(Cell targetCell)
    Since Hestia can't make her second build on a perimeter space, we check for this condition A perimeter space is a cell that has x==0 || x==4 || y==0 || y==4
    void printCLI​(ModelUtils modelCopy, java.util.List<Cell> validMoves)
    Here I print the CLI for the user, depending on the parameter validMoves If it is null, I print the normal battlefield with the tokens on, with the number on every cell representing its height, X if dome, and the background in the color of the token on it (if present); Otherwise i print even a green backgrounds behind the cells in the ValidMoves param

  • Constructor Details

    • View

      public View()
      Creates a new view and prints SANTORINI with ascii art

  • Method Details

    • getPlayer

      protected Player getPlayer()
      Returns:
      the player of this view

    • getUserInput

      public java.lang.String[] getUserInput()
      Get an input from stdin and divide it when there is a comma
      Returns:
      a String[2] with those numbers in it if the input are 2 numbers separated with a comma, null else

    • notifyClient

      public void notifyClient​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      Once a player has performed his move, it is notified to the client
      Parameters:
      playerAction - move to send to the client. He will send it into the socket
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • update

      public void update​(ServerResponse serverResponse) throws java.io.IOException
      This method moves the mechanic of the game: it receives the response from the server, parse it to identify the kind of action and ask the user to insert the correct input
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<ServerResponse>
      Parameters:
      serverResponse - : response received from the server containing all the necessary information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • getToken

      public int getToken​(java.lang.String[] inputs, Player player)
      When a player inserts an input to move a token, here is identified which token a player wants to move
      Parameters:
      inputs - String[] that should contain something like ["2","3"]
      player - the player who gave the String[] input
      Returns:
      the token ID of that player in that position. 0 if something goes wrong

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(java.lang.String[] inputs, Battlefield battlefield)
      Get an input from a player and return the corresponding cell of the battlefield
      Parameters:
      inputs - String[] that should contain something like ["2","3"]
      battlefield - the model's battlefield copy received in server response
      Returns:
      the cell of the battlefield with the coordinates written in inputs. Null if something goes wrong

    • isFree

      public boolean isFree​(Cell targetCell, ModelUtils modelCopy)
      Ask if a target cell of the battlefield is free or not It is free if there is not a token on it nor a dome
      Parameters:
      targetCell - a cell we are asking for
      modelCopy - model copy received from the server
      Returns:
      true if that cell is free, false else

    • notPerimeterCell

      public boolean notPerimeterCell​(Cell targetCell)
      Since Hestia can't make her second build on a perimeter space, we check for this condition A perimeter space is a cell that has x==0 || x==4 || y==0 || y==4
      Parameters:
      targetCell - cell we are asking for
      Returns:
      true if that cell is not on a perimeter zone of the battlefield

    • askYesOrNot

      public boolean askYesOrNot()
      Get a user input and parse it
      Returns:
      true if he write something similar to yes, false else

    • cellIsInValidCells

      public boolean cellIsInValidCells​(Cell targetCell, java.util.List<Cell> validCells)
      Tells if a cell got from user is a valid cell
      Parameters:
      targetCell - cell got from user
      validCells - valid cells got from model
      Returns:
      true if target cell is in the valid cells

    • isAGoodName

      public java.lang.String isAGoodName​(java.lang.String name)
      Parameters:
      name - string to check. It is the user input for his username
      Returns:
      true if it is not empty, too long(<=16) or with spaces

    • printCLI

      public void printCLI​(ModelUtils modelCopy, java.util.List<Cell> validMoves)
      Here I print the CLI for the user, depending on the parameter validMoves If it is null, I print the normal battlefield with the tokens on, with the number on every cell representing its height, X if dome, and the background in the color of the token on it (if present); Otherwise i print even a green backgrounds behind the cells in the ValidMoves param
      Parameters:
      validMoves - : cells that have to be printed on a green background (can be null)
      modelCopy - : contains the board of the game and the players in the game

    • printGameOver

      public void printGameOver​(boolean hasWin)
      Prints ascii art of "YOU WON" or "YOU LOST", depending on:
      Parameters:
      hasWin - true if this player won, else if he lost

    • printSANTORINI

      public void printSANTORINI()
      Prints SANTORINI in ascii art

    • printNResetSpaces

      public void printNResetSpaces​(int n)
      prints n times a space on the reset color background
      Parameters:
      n - times

    • printNBlueSpaces

      public void printNBlueSpaces​(int n)
      Prints n times a space on a blue background
      Parameters:
      n - times
